title: How to Create Candles from Eggshells

steps.headline: Crack the eggs carefully.
steps.description: Whenever you're creating (or collecting) the eggshells, crack with care so that a large portion of the bottom half of the egg is left intact and unbroken. Keep the eggshells cracked side up in an egg carton, for ease of working with and moving about.

steps.headline: Place a wick inside each egg.
steps.description: Position the eggshells so that the inside of the egg is facing upward. Don’t remove from the carton as the carton will hold the eggshells in place. For more precision when working with a single egg, use an egg cup, as shown in the images. Return the filled eggshell to the carton when done.

steps.headline: Tie the wick end to the chopstick, stick or pencil to hold in place.
steps.description: Center the wicks in the approximate middle of the eggshell.

methods.name: Adding the Melted Wax to the Eggshell

steps.headline: Pour the melted wax into each eggshell.
steps.description: Use a funnel to improve your pouring accuracy. Fill each eggshell only 1/3 of the way with wax.

steps.headline: Allow the wax to set before trimming the wick.
steps.description: It is then ready for lighting.

steps.headline: Color the eggs shell if desired.
steps.description: While optional, this may be something that adds to your party or house theme. You can paint special designs on the eggs if wished.

steps.headline: Let the paint dry completely before lighting the candles.

text: Preparing the Eggshells Crack the eggs carefully. Whenever you're creating (or collecting) the eggshells, crack with care so that a large portion of the bottom half of the egg is left intact and unbroken. Keep the eggshells cracked side up in an egg carton, for ease of working with and moving about. Place a wick inside each egg. Position the eggshells so that the inside of the egg is facing upward. Don’t remove from the carton as the carton will hold the eggshells in place. For more precision when working with a single egg, use an egg cup, as shown in the images. Return the filled eggshell to the carton when done. Tie the wick end to the chopstick, stick or pencil to hold in place. Center the wicks in the approximate middle of the eggshell. Adding the Melted Wax to the Eggshell Pour the melted wax into each eggshell. Use a funnel to improve your pouring accuracy. Fill each eggshell only 1/3 of the way with wax. Allow the wax to set before trimming the wick. It is then ready for lighting. Decorating the Eggshell Candles Color the eggs shell if desired. While optional, this may be something that adds to your party or house theme. You can paint special designs on the eggs if wished. Let the paint dry completely before lighting the candles.  Finished.
